snippet: President Obama made clear that he was not issuing a blanket indictment of either the protesting crowds or the law enforcement officers responding to the demonstrations.
abstract: Pres Obama calls for calm and healing in Ferguson, Mo, where riots over fatal shooting by police of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown reveal deep racial divisions between minorities and law enforcement in cities across the United States; criticizes both protesters and police involved, making clear that he is not issuing a blanket indictment of either side.
lead_paragraph: President Obama made clear that he was not issuing a blanket indictment of either the protesting crowds or the law enforcement officers responding to the demonstrations.

headline.main: Calling for Calm in Ferguson, Obama Cites Need for Improved Race Relations
headline.print_headline: Calling for Calm in Ferguson, Obama Cites Need for Improved Race Relations
